Utterance: Hi again! It's good to see you. How have you been since our last session?
Hi Ellie! I've been okay, I guess. It's been a bit of a rollercoaster, but I'm hanging in there.
I'm glad to hear you're hanging in there. What has been the most significant thing on your mind lately?
Well, I've been thinking a lot about my son and the custody situation. It's just so stressful.
That sounds really tough. Have you had any updates on the custody case since we last spoke?
Not really. Just the same tension with my family. They keep pushing their views on me, and I feel overwhelmed.
It sounds like you're feeling a lot of pressure from your family. How are you coping with that pressure?
I try to remind myself that I know what's best for my son, but it's hard when everyone else is so vocal about their opinions.
That's understandable. It’s important to trust your instincts as a parent. Have you found any specific strategies that help you manage that pressure?
I’ve been trying to journal more about my feelings, but sometimes I just end up crying instead.
Journaling can be a powerful tool, even if it leads to tears. What do you usually write about when you're journaling?
Mostly about my worries, like how I’m going to prove I’m a good mom. I write about my hopes for my son too.
That’s a great approach. It can help clarify your thoughts and feelings. Have you noticed any patterns in what you write about?
Yeah, I tend to focus on the negative things, like my fears about losing him. I don’t write enough about the positive moments.
Recognizing that pattern is a good first step. How might you incorporate more positive reflections into your journaling?
Maybe I could start each entry with something good that happened that day, no matter how small.
That sounds like a wonderful idea! Focusing on the positives can help shift your mindset. How do you feel about trying that in your next journal entry?
I feel good about it! I think it could help me see things differently.
Great! Let's check in on your mood. How have you been feeling overall in the past week?
Honestly, I've had some ups and downs. Some days I feel okay, but others I just feel really down like I can't get out of bed.
I'm sorry to hear that. It sounds like you're experiencing some fluctuations in your mood. Have you noticed any triggers for those down days?
I think it’s mostly when I think about my son. The missing him just hits me hard sometimes.
That makes sense. It’s natural to feel that way. Have you considered any coping strategies for those particularly tough days?
I’ve tried to distract myself by watching shows or reading, but sometimes it just doesn’t work.
Distraction can be helpful, but it’s also important to sit with those feelings sometimes. Have you tried any mindfulness or grounding techniques?
I haven’t really, but I think I should. I’ve heard they can help.
Mindfulness can be very beneficial. Would you like to explore a simple grounding technique together?
Sure, I’d like that.
Okay, let’s try a quick exercise. Take a deep breath in… and slowly let it out. Now, focus on your surroundings. Can you name three things you can see right now?
Um, I see my couch, a picture of my son, and my coffee mug.
Great! Now, can you name two things you can hear?
I hear the clock ticking and some birds outside.
Perfect. And finally, can you name one thing you can feel right now?
I can feel the cushion of the couch under me.
Excellent! This exercise can help bring you back to the present moment when you’re feeling overwhelmed. How do you feel after trying that?
I feel a little calmer. It was nice to focus on something other than my worries for a moment.
I’m glad to hear that! Integrating these techniques into your routine can help you manage those tough moments. Would you be willing to practice this grounding exercise at home?
Yes, I think I can do that. It feels manageable.
Wonderful! As we wrap up today, what’s one goal you’d like to focus on before our next session?
I’d like to try to write more positively in my journal and practice the grounding exercise when I feel anxious.
Those sound like excellent goals! I’m looking forward to hearing how it goes next time. Remember, it’s okay to take things one step at a time.
Thank you, Ellie. I appreciate your support.
You’re very welcome! Take care, and I’ll see you next week.
Bye!
Bye!
